citation.article-title: Altererythrobacter ishigakiensis sp. nov., an astaxanthin-producing bacterium isolated from a marine sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Altererythrobacter ishigakiensis sp. nov.
Altererythrobacter ishigakiensis (i.shi.ga.ki.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. ishigakiensis of or belonging to Ishigaki island, Okinawa, Japan, where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are non-motile rods, Gram-negative and strictly aerobic (0.3–0.5 µm wide and 1.5–2.0 µm long).
Colonies are orange–red, round, convex and smooth.
The carotenoids astaxanthin, adonixanthin, echinenone, canthaxanthin and echinenone are present; astaxanthin, adonixanthin and zeaxanthin are the chief pigments.
Optimum growth is observed at 35 °C, pH 7.5 and 1.5–2.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth does not occur in the absence of NaCl.
Reduces nitrate, produces catalase, oxidase and β-galactosidase and hydrolyses aesculin, but does not produce arginine dihydrolase, urease or indole or hydrolyse gelatin.
Does not utilize d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maltose, potassium gluconate, n-capric acid, adipic acid, malate, sodium citrate or phenylacetate.

The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C14 : 0 2-OH; the minor fatty acids are C14 : 0, C15 : 0, C16 : 0, C17 : 0, C18 : 0, C16 : 1ω5c, C17 : 1ω6c, C17 : 1ω8c, C12 : 0 2-OH, C15 : 0 2-OH and C16 : 0 2-OH.
The type strain, JPCCMB0017T ( = NITE-AP48T = ATCC BAA-2084T = NBRC 107699T), was isolated from a marine sediment obtained from the coastal area of Okinawa, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.1 mol%.
